required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Minor Troponin Elevations in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Etiology of Minor Troponin Elevations in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation Visiting Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims at identifying the etiology of troponin-T elevations in patients with atrial fibrillation visiting the emergency department.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study is to identify the factors associated with minor cardiac troponin-T elevations in patients presenting in emergency department (ED) with atrial fibrillation (AF) diagnosis , and the possible implications it has on the patients prognosis. Data on 3394 patients from the Turku university hospital catchment area with diagnosis of AF on admission to ED and minor troponin-T elevation were analyzed. Patients were classified into three groups according to the troponin-T value: troponin <15ng/l, 15-50ng/l and 51-100ng/l. Individual patient records were reviewed.

primary_outcome.measure: All-cause mortality, myocardial infarction, ischemic stroke
primary_outcome.description: Major adverse cardiac or cerebrovascular event within one year

study_pop.textblock: Patients with atrial fibrillation admitted to Turku University Hospital emergency department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- two troponin T tests within 72 hours of ED admission
- Prior diagnosis of AF or AF at admission
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18 years
